title: Rear ABS Pulser Ring - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Remove the rear wheel D34; D54; D64; DC; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DD2; DD4; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DPZ; DW4; DX4; DZ; DVB; DWB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DVB; DWB; DCZ; DPZ; D34; DX4; DW4; DD4; D64; D54; DC4; DP4; DEX; DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DD2; DC; DC3; DP; DZ; DPA; DP2; DP3

body.body: Rear Pulser Ring Removal - D Series Except DD2 DD4 DE DE2 DEX DF DF2
Remove and discard the four fixings and remove the pulser ring.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DWB; DVB; DUC; DUB; DTB; DTC; DPZ; DCZ; DX4; DW4; D74; DR4; DS4; DU4; DT4; D64; D54; DB4; DP4; DC4; D72; D92; D71; DVY; DU3; DT3; DW; DVX; DV; DSB; DSA; DSX; DS1; DUY; DU; DC3; DC; DZA; DZ; DA2; DBX; DB2; DB; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP
